name: flossy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
very bright, colourful, or expensive in a way that is intended to get attention and admiration: He was brought up amongst people for whom being "flossy" is considered desirable. She's a stereotypical bleached and flossy megastar.
More examplesFewer examplesThese clubs attract the flossier, more upscale clientele.It's not enough just to have the latest fabulous, flossy handbag.They've received hundreds of calls a day since they launched the series, which is set in a flossy neighborhood.
